channel.title: Server migration soon (new hardware!)
channel.description:
I'm switching from our current server, to this one:
https://www.gigenet.com/order/index.php?order=true&form=448
It has 10x the connection speed, 10x the monthly bandwidth, 4x the hard drive space, and slightly faster RAM, all for the same price!
The one thing I'm unsure of is the CPU, it should be faster, but it has slightly less cache, and instead of telling me the L1, L2, and L3 cache size, all the new one lists is 'smart cache'. Can anyone shed light on this?
Old CPU: Intel Xeon E5410 @ 2.33GHz New CPU: Intel Xeon E3-1230 @ 3.2Ghz
The actual downtime should be very minimal, I'll transfer everything while we run and have to shut down the MySQL server very briefly while I transfer across the differences and start it back up. DNS propagation won't be an issue because I'll setup a reverse proxy on this server that goes to the new one while DNS propagates.

item.title: Server migration soon (new hardware!)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Pwnd:

Good thing it’s at the same price… because these forums could run off of a P4 lul.

The server also hosts moparcraft, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Server migration soon (new hardware!)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If http://www.cpubenchmark.net/ is anything to go by, an E3-1230 beats dual E5410s.

E5410 has 4 cores at 4 threads, while the E3-1230 has 4 cores at 8 threads, which will make a hell of a difference when programs can utilise them. The E3-1230 also has a turbo mode which enabled will boost the clock to 3.6ghz when required. By all accounts the wiki for smart cache is adequate but the consensus is that it’s an irrelevant spec when deciding what CPU to buy.

Read full topic
